title-group.article-title: Local incentives and national tax evasion
title-group.subtitle: Unintended effects of a mining reform in Colombia

abstract.p: There is a growing trend in developing countries towards decentralizing spending. However, the tax revenue sources remain unchanged. The share of tax revenue transferred back for the locality where the taxed economic activity takes place could affect the incentives of local authorities to curb tax evasion. In this paper, we document that a reduction in the share of mining royalties transferred back to the mining municipalities in Colombia led to an increase in illegal mining. Although tax evasion might not have a welfare cost if it is just a transfer of resources, we show that illegal mining causes worse health outcomes for newborn children.
